meanings.sent1: The clown wore a queerer hat than the magician.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house looked even queerer in the moonlight.
meanings.sent3: The cat's behavior became queerer as it chased its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The old abandoned mansion had a queerer atmosphere than any other place in town.
meanings.sent5: The strange markings on the ancient artifact grew even queerer under the microscope.

meanings.definition: More strange or odd than something else
meanings.sent1: The new student's accent was even queerer than the teacher's.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious sound in the forest grew queerer as the night went on.
meanings.sent3: The cake tasted queerer with each additional ingredient added.
meanings.sent4: The shadows in the room seemed to take on a queerer shape as the light dimmed.
meanings.sent5: The strange plant in the garden looked even queerer next to the ordinary flowers.

meanings.definition: To make or become strange or odd
meanings.sent1: The magician used his wand to queerer the rabbit, making it disappear.
meanings.sent2: The fog began to queerer the outline of the distant mountains.
meanings.sent3: The potion had an unexpected effect, causing the room to queerer around the wizard.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to queerer the portrait, giving it an otherworldly appearance.
meanings.sent5: The strange music seemed to queerer the mood of the party, making everyone feel uneasy.
